</ul>
<div aria-label="Portals" class="noprint metadata navbox" role="navigation" style="font-weight:bold;padding:0.4em 2em">

<li style="display:inline"><span style="display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap"><span style="margin:0 0.5em"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg"><img alt="Flag of the Philippines.svg" data-file-height="450" data-file-width="900" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/24px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/36px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/48px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png 2x" width="24"/></a></span><a href="/wiki/Portal:Philippines" title="Portal:Philippines">Philippines portal</a></span></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<div class="mw-references-wrap">
<ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-a-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-a_1-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In the recognized regional <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_the_Philippines" title="Languages of the Philippines">languages of the Philippines</a>:</span>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Aklanon_language" title="Aklanon language">Aklanon</a>: <i>Republika it Pilipinas</i></span></li>
<li><span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Bikol_languages" title="Bikol languages">Bikol</a>: <i>Republika kan Filipinas</i></span></li>
<li><span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Cebuano_language" title="Cebuano language">Cebuano</a>: <span lang="ceb"><i>Republika sa Pilipinas</i></span></span></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Chavacano" title="Chavacano">Chavacano</a>: <i>República de Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hiligaynon_language" title="Hiligaynon language">Hiligaynon</a>: <i>Republika sang Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ibanag_language" title="Ibanag language">Ibanag</a>: <i>Republika nat Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ilocano_language" title="Ilocano language">Ilocano</a>: <i>Republika ti Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ivatan_language" title="Ivatan language">Ivatan</a>: <i>Republika nu Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Kapampangan_language" title="Kapampangan language">Kapampangan</a>: <i>Republika ning Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Kinaray-a_language" title="Kinaray-a language">Kinaray-a</a>: <i>Republika kang Pilipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Maranao_language" title="Maranao language">Maranao</a>: <i>Republika san Pilipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Pangasinan_language" title="Pangasinan language">Pangansinan</a>: <i>Republika na Filipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Sambal_language" title="Sambal language">Sambal</a>: <i>Republika nin Pilipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Surigaonon_language" title="Surigaonon language">Surigaonon</a>: <i>Republika nan Pilipinas</i></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Waray_language" title="Waray language">Waray</a>: <i>Republika han Pilipinas</i></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
In the recognized optional languages of the Philippines:
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_language" title="Spanish language">Spanish</a>: <span lang="es"><i>República de Filipinas</i></span></li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Arabic_language" title="Arabic language">Arabic</a>: <span dir="rtl" lang="ar">جمهورية الفلبين</span>‎, <small><a href="/wiki/Romanization_of_Arabic" title="Romanization of Arabic">translit.</a> </small><i><span class="Unicode" style="white-space:normal; text-decoration: none" title="Arabic transliteration">Jumhuriat Alfalabin</span></i>‎</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>

<li id="cite_note-Galang-34"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Galang_34-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book"><a href="/wiki/Zoilo_Galang" title="Zoilo Galang">Galang, Zoilo M.</a> (Ed.). (1957). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=lt5uAAAAMAAJ&amp;cd=2&amp;dq=islas+del+poniente+san+lazaro&amp;q=islas+del+poniente+#search_anchor" rel="nofollow"><i>Encyclopedia of the Philippines, Volume 15</i></a> (3rd ed.). E. Floro. p. 46.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.au=Galang%2C+Zoilo+M.+%28Ed.%29.&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopedia+of+the+Philippines%2C+Volume+15&amp;rft.date=1957&amp;rft.edition=3rd&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.pages=46&amp;rft.pub=E.+Floro&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3Dlt5uAAAAMAAJ%26cd%3D2%26dq%3Dislas%2Bdel%2Bponiente%2Bsan%2Blazaro%26q%3Dislas%2Bdel%2Bponiente%2B%23search_anchor&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>

<li id="cite_note-Miksic2009-52"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Miksic2009_52-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Miksic2009_52-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Miksic, John N. <li id="cite_note-Alfonso2016-70"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Alfonso2016_70-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Alfonso, Ian Christopher B. (2016). <i>The Nameless Hero: Revisiting the Sources on the First Filipino Leader to Die for Freedom</i>. Angeles: Holy Angel University Press. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9789710546527" title="Special:BookSources/9789710546527">9789710546527</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.au=Alfonso%2C+Ian+Christopher+B.&amp;rft.btitle=The+Nameless+Hero%3A+Revisiting+the+Sources+on+the+First+Filipino+Leader+to+Die+for+Freedom&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.isbn=9789710546527&amp;rft.place=Angeles&amp;rft.pub=Holy+Angel+University+Press&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-71">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Lucoes warriors<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Words_to_watch#Puffery" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Words to watch"><span title="Unverified descriptions (September 2017)">peacock term</span></a></i>]</sup> aided the Burmese king in his invasion of Siam in 1547 AD. At the same time, Lusung warriors fought alongside the Siamese king and faced the same elephant army of the Burmese king in the defence of the Siamese capital at Ayuthaya. SOURCE: Ibidem, page 195.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The former sultan of Malacca decided to retake his city from the Portuguese with a fleet of ships from Lusung in 1525 AD. SOURCE: Barros, Joao de, Decada terciera de Asia de Ioano de Barros dos feitos que os Portugueses fezarao no descubrimiento dos mares e terras de Oriente [1628], Lisbon, 1777, courtesy of William Henry Scott, Barangay: Sixteenth-Century Philippine Culture and Society, Quezon City: Ateneo de Manila University Press, 1994, page 194.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-Pigafetta-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Pigafetta_73-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal"><a href="/wiki/Antonio_Pigafetta" title="Antonio Pigafetta">Pigafetta, Antonio</a> (1969) [1524]. "First voyage round the world". Translated by J.A. Robertson. <li id="cite_note-87"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-87">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www.discoverbohol.com/Features/Dauis-History-Part-1.htm" rel="nofollow">History of the Kingdom of Dapitan</a>. <li id="cite_note-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-88">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Barrows, David (2014). <a class="external text" href="http://www.gutenberg.org/files/38269/38269-h/38269-h.htm#pb139" rel="nofollow">"A History of the Philippines"</a>. <i>Guttenburg Free Online E-books</i>. <b>1</b>: 139. <q>Fourth.—In considering this Spanish conquest, we must understand that the islands were far more sparsely inhabited than they are to-day. The Bisayan islands, the rich Camarines, the island of Luzon, had, in Legaspi's time, only a small fraction of their present great populations. This population was not only small, but it was also extremely disunited. Not only were the great tribes separated by the differences of language, but, as we have already seen, each tiny community was practically independent, and the power of a dato very limited. There were no great princes, with large forces of fighting retainers whom they could call to arms, such as the Portuguese had encountered among the Malays south in the Moluccas.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.atitle=A+History+of+the+Philippines&amp;rft.aufirst=David&amp;rft.aulast=Barrows&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Guttenburg+Free+Online+E-books&amp;rft.pages=139&amp;rft.volume=1&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gutenberg.org%2Ffiles%2F38269%2F38269-h%2F38269-h.htm%23pb139&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>

<li id="cite_note-97"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-97">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">de Sande, Francisco. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120730162315/http://www.filipiniana.net/publication/letter-from-francisco-de-sande-to-felipe-ii/12791881675822" rel="nofollow">"Letter from Francisco de Sande to Felipe II"</a>. <i>Filipiniana.net</i>. <li id="cite_note-107"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-107">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"Forced Migration in the Spanish Pacific World" By Eva Maria Mehl, page 235.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-108"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-108">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www.gutenberg.org/files/16086/16086-h/16086-h.htm" rel="nofollow">Letter from Fajardo to Felipe III From Manila, August 15 1620.(From the Spanish Archives of the Indies)</a> ("The infantry does not amount to two hundred men, in three companies. If these men were that number, and Spaniards, it would not be so bad; but, although I have not seen them, because they have not yet arrived here, I am told that they are, as at other times, for the most part <b>boys, mestizos, and mulattoes, with some Indians (Native Americans).</b> There is no little cause for regret in the great sums that reënforcements of such men waste for, and cost, your Majesty. I cannot see what betterment there will be until your Majesty shall provide it, since I do not think, that more can be done in Nueva Spaña, although the viceroy must be endeavoring to do so, as he is ordered.")</span></li>

<li id="cite_note-117"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-117">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Barrows, David (2014). <a class="external text" href="http://www.gutenberg.org/files/38269/38269-h/38269-h.htm#pb139" rel="nofollow">"A History of the Philippines"</a>. <i>Guttenburg Free Online E-books</i>. <b>1</b>: 179. <q>Within the walls, there were some six hundred houses of a private nature, most of them built of stone and tile, and an equal number outside in the suburbs, or "arrabales," all occupied by Spaniards ("todos son vivienda y poblacion de los Españoles"). This gives some twelve hundred Spanish families or establishments, exclusive of the religious, who in Manila numbered at least one hundred and fifty, the garrison, at certain times, about four hundred trained Spanish soldiers who had seen service in Holland and the Low Countries, and the official classes.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.atitle=A+History+of+the+Philippines&amp;rft.aufirst=David&amp;rft.aulast=Barrows&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Guttenburg+Free+Online+E-books&amp;rft.pages=179&amp;rft.volume=1&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gutenberg.org%2Ffiles%2F38269%2F38269-h%2F38269-h.htm%23pb139&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>

<li id="cite_note-123"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-123">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Halstead, M (1898). <i>The Story of the Philippines</i>. US State Department Website. January 2012. Archived from <a class="external text" href="https://travel.state.gov/travel/cis_pa_tw/cis/cis_999.html#country" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on January 3, 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">January 24,</span> 2012</span>. <q>The Philippines is an emerging economy with a democratic system of government.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.atitle=Country+description&amp;rft.date=2012-01&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=US+State+Department+Website&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ftravel.state.gov%2Ftravel%2Fcis_pa_tw%2Fcis%2Fcis_999.html%23country&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-217"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-217">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Robles, Alan C. <li id="cite_note-Reddel-320"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Reddel_320-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Reddel, Paul (May 27, 2009). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20121114025256/http://www.ppiaf.org/feature-story/infrastructure-and-ppps-philippines" rel="nofollow"><i>Infrastructure &amp; Public-Private Partnerships in East Asia and the Philippines</i></a> [PowerPoint slides]. <li id="cite_note-414"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-414">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4757630/" rel="nofollow">The final component (dark blue in Fig. 3b) has a high frequency in South China (Fig. 2b) and is also seen in Taiwan at ~25–30 %, <b>in the Philippines at ~20–30 %</b> (except in one location which is almost zero) and across Indonesia/Malaysia at 1–10 %, declining overall from Taiwan within Austronesian-speaking populations.("Resolving the ancestry of Austronesian-speaking populations", Published by "Springer: Human Genetics" January 18 2016.)</a></span></li>

<li id="cite_note-417"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-417">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"In 1637 the military force maintained in the islands consisted of one thousand seven hundred and two Spaniards and one hundred and forty Indians." ~<i>Memorial de D. Juan Grau y Monfalcon, Procurador General de las Islas Filipinas, Docs. Inéditos del Archivo de Indias, vi, p. 425.</i> "In 1787 <i>the garrison at Manila consisted of one regiment of Mexicans comprising one thousand three hundred men, two artillery companies of eighty men each, three cavalry companies of fifty men each.</i>" <i>La Pérouse, ii, p. 368.</i></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-418"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-418">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Jagor, Fëdor, et al. <li id="cite_note-419"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-419">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">*Institute for Human Genetics, University of California San Francisco (2015). <a class="external text" href="http://www.genetics.org/content/early/2015/06/18/genetics.115.178616.full.pdf+html" rel="nofollow">"Self-identified East Asian nationalities correlated with genetic clustering, consistent with extensive endogamy. Individuals of mixed East Asian-European genetic ancestry were easily identified; we also observed a modest amount of European genetic ancestry in individuals self-identified as Filipinos"</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(PDF)</span>. <i>Genetics Online</i>: 1.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.atitle=Self-identified+East+Asian+nationalities+correlated+with+genetic+clustering%2C+consistent+with+extensive+endogamy.+Individuals+of+mixed+East+Asian-European+genetic+ancestry+were+easily+identified%3B+we+also+observed+a+modest+amount+of+European+genetic+ancestry+in+individuals+self-identified+as+Filipinos&amp;rft.au=%2AInstitute+for+Human+Genetics%2C+University+of+California+San+Francisco&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Genetics+Online&amp;rft.pages=1&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.genetics.org%2Fcontent%2Fearly%2F2015%2F06%2F18%2Fgenetics.115.178616.full.pdf%2Bhtml&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-420"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-420">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www6.appliedbiosystems.com/yfilerdatabase/" rel="nofollow">With a sample population of 105 Filipinos, the company of <i>Applied Biosystems</i>, analysed the Y-DNA of average Filipinos and it is discovered that about 13.33% of the samples have the Y-DNA Haplotype "R1b", which is most common in Western Europe and had spread to the Philippines via Spanish colonists.</a></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-421"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-421">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://genographic.nationalgeographic.com/reference-populations-next-gen/" rel="nofollow">The average Filipino's genes are around 53% Southeast Asian and Oceanian, 36% East Asian, 5% Southern European, 3% South Asian and 2% Native American. NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC: THE GENOGRAPHIC PROJECT. (Geno 2.0 The Next Generation)</a></span></li>

<li id="cite_note-431"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-431">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Kalaw, Maximo M. (1927). <a class="external text" href="http://quod.lib.umich.edu/cgi/t/text/text-idx?c=philamer;idno=AFJ2233.0001.001" rel="nofollow">"The development of Philippine politics"</a>. Oriental commercial: <a class="external text" href="http://quod.lib.umich.edu/cgi/t/text/pageviewer-idx?c=philamer;cc=philamer;idno=afj2233.0001.001;view=image;seq=451;size=100;page=root" rel="nofollow">431</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.atitle=The+development+of+Philippine+politics&amp;rft.aufirst=Maximo+M.&amp;rft.aulast=Kalaw&amp;rft.date=1927&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.pages=431&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fquod.lib.umich.edu%2Fcgi%2Ft%2Ftext%2Ftext-idx%3Fc%3Dphilamer%3Bidno%3DAFJ2233.0001.001&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>

<li id="cite_note-469"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-469">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www.preventionweb.net/organizations/13426" rel="nofollow">Commission on Higher Education</a> The Commission on Higher Education is the governing body covering both public and private higher education institutions as well as degree-granting programs in all tertiary educational institutions in the Philippines. The CHED was established on May 18, 1994 through Republic Act 7722 or the Higher Education Act.</span></li>

<li id="cite_note-CRVP2-493"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-CRVP2_493-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Talisayon, Serafin (1994). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160417164213/http://www.crvp.org/book/Series03/III-7/chapter_xiii.htm" rel="nofollow">"Filipino Values, Chapter XIII, Teaching Values in the Natural and Physical Sciences in the Philippines"</a>. <i>crvp.org</i>. In <cite class="citation book">Dy, Manuel B., Jr., ed. (March 10, 1994). <i>Values in Philippine Culture and Education (Philippine Philosophical Studies, Series III, Volume 7)</i>. Cultural heritage and contemporary change. Council for Research in Values and Philosophy. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/1-56518-040-2" title="Special:BookSources/1-56518-040-2">1-56518-040-2</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.btitle=Values+in+Philippine+Culture+and+Education+%28Philippine+Philosophical+Studies%2C+Series+III%2C+Volume+7%29&amp;rft.date=1994-03-10&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.isbn=1-56518-040-2&amp;rft.pub=Council+for+Research+in+Values+and+Philosophy&amp;rft.series=Cultural+heritage+and+contemporary+change&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span><span class="citation-comment" style="display:none; color:#33aa33; margin-left:0.3em">CS1 maint: Multiple names: editors list (<a href="/wiki/Category:CS1_maint:_Multiple_names:_editors_list" title="Category:CS1 maint: Multiple names: editors list">link</a>)</span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-494"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-494">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Sabillo, Kristine Angeli. <a class="external text" href="http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/128471/philippines-first-to-win-all-five-intl-beauty-pageants" rel="nofollow">"Philippines first to win all five int'l beauty pageants"</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines&amp;rft.aufirst=Kristine+Angeli&amp;rft.aulast=Sabillo&amp;rft.btitle=Philippines+first+to+win+all+five+int%27l+beauty+pageants&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flifestyle.inquirer.net%2F128471%2Fphilippines-first-to-win-all-five-intl-beauty-pageants&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook"><span style="display:none;"> </span></span></span></li>

<ul>

<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.pnp.gov.ph/" rel="nofollow">Official website of the Philippine National Police (PNP)</a></li>

</ul>

<div id="22x22px.7Clink.3D.7Calt.3D.C2.A0.C2.A0Administrative_divisions_of_the_Philippines" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><img alt="" data-file-height="568" data-file-width="512" height="22" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/84/Coat_of_arms_of_the_Philippines.svg/20px-Coat_of_arms_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/84/Coat_of_arms_of_the_Philippines.svg/30px-Coat_of_arms_of_the_Philippines.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/84/Coat_of_arms_of_the_Philippines.svg/40px-Coat_of_arms_of_the_Philippines.svg.png 2x" width="20"/>  <a href="/wiki/Administrative_divisions_of_the_Philippines" title="Administrative divisions of the Philippines">Administrative divisions</a> of the <a class="mw-selflink selflink">Philippines</a></div>

<td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em"></div>
<table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">

<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_Netherlands" title="Spanish Netherlands">Netherlands</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/History_of_the_Philippines_(1521%E2%80%931898)" title="History of the Philippines (1521–1898)">Philippines</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_East_Indies" title="Spanish East Indies">East Pacific</a> <small>(Guam, Mariana, Caroline, Palau, Marshall, Micronesia, Moluccas)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_Formosa" title="Spanish Formosa">Northern Taiwan</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Tidore" title="Tidore">Tidore</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_Florida" title="Spanish Florida">Florida</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Louisiana_(New_Spain)" title="Louisiana (New Spain)">Spanish Louisiana</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_expeditions_to_the_Pacific_Northwest" title="Spanish expeditions to the Pacific Northwest">Coastal Alaska</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/History_of_Haiti#Spanish_history_.281492.E2.80.931625.29" title="History of Haiti">Haiti</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Colony_of_Santiago" title="Colony of Santiago">Jamaica</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/History_of_Trinidad_and_Tobago#Spanish_period" title="History of Trinidad and Tobago">Trinidad and Tobago</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Captaincy_General_of_Venezuela" title="Captaincy General of Venezuela">Venezuela, Northern and Western Guyana</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Viceroyalty_of_New_Granada" title="Viceroyalty of New Granada">New Granada</a> <small>(Panama, Colombia, Ecuador, a northernmost portion of Brazilian Amazon)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Viceroyalty_of_Peru" title="Viceroyalty of Peru">Peru</a> <small>(Peru, Acre)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Viceroyalty_of_the_R%C3%ADo_de_la_Plata" title="Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata">Río de la Plata</a> <small>(Argentina, Paraguay, <a href="/wiki/Real_Audiencia_of_Charcas" title="Real Audiencia of Charcas">Charcas</a> (Bolivia), <a href="/wiki/Banda_Oriental" title="Banda Oriental">Banda Oriental</a> (Uruguay), <a href="/wiki/History_of_the_Falkland_Islands" title="History of the Falkland Islands">Falkland Islands</a>)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Captaincy_General_of_Chile" title="Captaincy General of Chile">Chile</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Spanish_Guinea" title="Spanish Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a></li>
<li>Spanish North Africa <small>(<a href="/wiki/Ifni" title="Ifni">Ifni</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cape_Juby" title="Cape Juby">Cape Juby</a>, <a href="/wiki/Spanish_protectorate_in_Morocco" title="Spanish protectorate in Morocco">Spanish Morocco</a> and <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Sahara" title="Spanish Sahara">Western Sahara</a>)</small></li>
</ul>

<div aria-labelledby="25px.C2.A0Geographic_locale" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px">
<table class="nowraplinks collapsible collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit">
<tr>
<th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#e8e8ff;">
<div id="25px.C2.A0Geographic_locale" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Gnome-globe.svg"><img alt="Gnome-globe.svg" data-file-height="48" data-file-width="48" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/25px-Gnome-globe.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/38px-Gnome-globe.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/50px-Gnome-globe.svg.png 2x" width="25"/></a><span class="nowrap"> </span>Geographic locale</div>
</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0px;font-size:114%;">
<div style="padding:0px;"><b><a href="/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system" title="Geographic coordinate system">Lat. <small>and</small> Long.</a> <span class="plainlinks nourlexpansion"><a class="external text" href="//tools.wmflabs.org/geohack/geohack.php?pagename=Philippines&amp;params=14_35_N_121_0_E_"><span class="geo-default"><span class="geo-dms" title="Maps, aerial photos, and other data for this location"><span class="latitude">14°35′N</span> <span class="longitude">121°0′E</span></span></span><span class="geo-multi-punct">﻿ / ﻿</span><span class="geo-nondefault"><span class="geo-dec" title="Maps, aerial photos, and other data for this location">14.583°N 121.000°E</span><span style="display:none">﻿ / <span class="geo">14.583; 121.000</span></span></span></a></span> <span style="color:darkblue;">(Manila)</span></b>
<div aria-labelledby="Countries_and_dependencies_of_Asia" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px">
<table class="nowraplinks collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit">

<div><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:American-MNNA-2007.svg" title="Map showing the Major non-NATO allies"><img alt="Map showing the Major non-NATO allies" data-file-height="443" data-file-width="863" height="51" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/American-MNNA-2007.svg/100px-American-MNNA-2007.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/American-MNNA-2007.svg/150px-American-MNNA-2007.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/American-MNNA-2007.svg/200px-American-MNNA-2007.svg.png 2x" width="100"/></a></div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em"><b>Potential countries</b>
<ul>
<li><i><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Flag_of_Georgia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Georgia.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Flag_of_Georgia.svg/35px-Flag_of_Georgia.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Flag_of_Georgia.svg/45px-Flag_of_Georgia.svg.png 2x" width="23"/> </span><a href="/wiki/Georgia_(country)" title="Georgia (country)">Georgia</a></i></li>

<td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">

<li><a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Italy" title="Economy of Italy">Italy</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2">
<div>
<ol>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China">Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China</a>, participates as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao China".</li>
<li>Officially the Republic of China, participates as "<a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu</a>", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
